headline: Clayton M. Christensen, Guru of ‘Disruptive Innovation,’ Is Dead at 67
abstract: He broke ground with his assertion that the factors that helped the best companies succeed were also the reasons some of those same companies failed.
lead_paragraph: Clayton M. Christensen, a Harvard professor whose groundbreaking 1997 book, “The Innovator’s Dilemma,” outlined his theories about the impact of what he called “disruptive innovation” on leading companies and catapulted him to superstar status as a management guru, died on Thursday in a Boston hospital. He was 67.
keywords: The Innovator's Dilemma: When New Technologies Cause Great Firms to Fail (Book)
